title: AI for Everyone
description: This course, led by Andrew Ng, is designed for non-technical professionals and covers the impact of AI on business and society. It is free and takes about 10 hours to complete.

title: Google Cloud Introduction to Generative AI
description: This free course introduces generative AI and large language models, focusing on Google’s tools and ethical practices. It takes approximately 8.5 hours to complete.

title: IBM Introduction to AI
description: This eight-hour course covers a wide range of AI topics, including ethical concerns. It can be audited for free on Coursera.

title: Oxford AI Program
description: This comprehensive six-week online course is targeted at business leaders and IT managers. It costs $2,748 and offers a certification upon completion.

title: Harvard CS50 AI
description: This seven-week course covers probability, logical inference, machine learning, and more. It is free, with an optional upgrade for certification.

title: Stanford AI
description: This 16-week course covers AI fundamentals and applications, taught by renowned computer scientists Sebastian Thrun and Peter Norvig.

title: AI for Business
description: This 15-hour course explores business applications of AI, requiring a basic understanding of high school math and Python programming.

title: IBM Applied AI
description: This seven-month program teaches AI-powered applications, including chatbots and machine learning, using Python and IBM’s Watson AI service.

title: MIT AI Strategy
description: This course covers AI’s implications for business strategy, helping professionals create a compelling business case for AI integration.

title: IBM AI Applications
description: This intermediate-level course focuses on using IBM’s Watson for smarter AI applications. It is free, with an optional upgrade for certification.
